data.title: Gold Weekly Price Forecast ‚Äì Gold Markets Form Inverted Hammer
data.text: Gold markets initially tried to rally for the week but broke down to show signs of hesitation.

data.title: Gold Price Forecast ‚Äì Gold Markets Gap Lower and Show Weakness
data.text: Gold has gapped lower during the trading session on Friday, and then turned around to fill that gap. Since then, we have touched the 50-Day EMA.

data.title: Gold, Silver, Palladium ‚Äì Palladium Markets Test New Lows Amid Demand Concerns
data.text: Rising Treasury yields and strong dollar put significant pressure on precious metals.

data.title: USD/CAD Battered By Strong Employment While Gold, Dax And JPY Erase A Portion Of Recent Gains
data.text: Employment, inflation and interest rates remain prominent drivers of price action as monetary policy remains at the forefront of sentiment for Forex and stocks.The Friday Market Oulook with Tammy Da Costa gives a report on the latest changes in the Ô¨Ånancial markets, providing timely fundamental, economic and technical analysis and a close examination of promising chart formations with live currency quotes which you can look foward to. 00:00 - Introduction 00:26 - USD/CAD 02:54 - Market Outlook For more access to actionable and authoritative views on global financial markets:üìà ‚û°Ô∏è https://www.dailyfx.com/ Subscribe to DailyFX for access to self-serve market information for traders to apply and enhance their own analysis.

data.title: Rising Gold prices in the second half of the year to pull up Silver too ‚Äì Commerzbank
data.text: Silver has dropped back again this year. But strategists at Commerzbank expect increasing Gold prices to lift Silver too.

data.title: Gold Forecast ‚Äì Temporary Correction Followed by a Breakout Above $2000
data.text: After a brief pullback, we expect gold to rally and breakout above $2000 in the second or third quarter.

data.title: Gold Price Forecast: XAU/USD has probably run out of steam ‚Äì Commerzbank
data.text: Gold has been virtually unable to recover from its setback. Economists at Commerzbank expect the yellow metal to struggle for the time being.

data.title: Gold Price Forecast: XAU/USD hangs near one-month low amid stronger US Dollar
data.text: Gold price meets with some supply near the $1,872 region, or the 100-hour Simple Moving Average (SMA), and stalls its modest intraday recovery from over a one-month low touched this Friday. The XAU/USD is currently placed in neutral territory, just above the $1,860 level, and is influenced by a combination of diverging forces.

data.title: Gold Price Forecast: Ominous Signs for XAU/USD
data.text: XAU/USD price action reveals some bearish technical indications as markets await key U.S. economic data.

data.title: Gold Price Forecast: XAU/USD charts a Bear Flag, putting the 50-DMA at risk
data.text: Gold price is sitting at the lowest level in five weeks near the $1,850 mark. As FXStreet's Dhwani Mehta notes, XAU/USD looks south amid Bear Flag.

data.title: Gold Futures: Extra losses appear not favoured
data.text: CME Group's flash data for gold futures markets noted traders reduced their open interest positions for yet another session on Thursday, this time by nearly 3K contracts. On the other hand, volume kept the choppiness intact and increased by around 50.6K contracts after the previous daily drop.

data.title: Gold Price Forecast: XAU/USD stays bearish below $1,873, US inflation clues eyed ‚Äì Confluence Detector
data.text: Gold price (XAU/USD) treads water around the mid-$1,800s, despite bracing for the second weekly loss, as market players struggle for clear directions amid contrasting fundamentals and anxiety ahead of the key United States data.  That said, Thursday's softer US Jobless Claims allowed Richmond Fed President Thomas Barkin to follow Fed Chair Jerome Powell and mark hesitance in raising the rates further.

data.title: Gold Prices Sink as US Dollar Rallies on Fading Fed Pivot Bets, Where to?
data.text: Gold prices fell on Thursday as hawkish Fedspeak and jobless claims data bolstered the US Dollar and Treasury yields. Is there more pain ahead for XAU/USD?

data.title: Gold Price Forecast: XAU/USD defies bullish bias on United States Treasury yield curve inversion, US data eyed
data.text: Gold price (XAU/USD) remains depressed at around $1,860 as markets await the key United States data during early Friday. It's worth noting that the US Treasury bond yields renewed recession fears and weighed on the XAU/USD price the previous day.

data.title: Gold Price Forecast: XAU/USD bears are hunting down ambitious $1,825 target
data.text: Gold price was falling on Thursday in a US session sell-off that followed a spike leading into the cash open on Wall Street where heightened volatility led to the collapse of the Gold price. The US Dollar, despite the dovish take on the Federal Reserve, rallied which sank all ships on the day.

data.title: Gold Price Forecast: XAU/USD struggles around $1890s and dives despite US Dollar weakness
data.text: Gold prices remained downward pressured on Thursday, even though the US Dollar (USD) is printing losses of 0.48%. Meanwhile, US Treasury bond yields extended their losses from around weekly highs at 3.692% to 3.592%, a tailwind for Gold prices.

data.title: Gold Prices Held Hostage by Fed Expectations ‚Äì What Next for XAU?
data.text: Gold prices currently remain below the key psychological level of $1,900 as Fed expectations continue to keep bulls in check.

data.title: Gold, Silver, Platinum ‚Äì Platinum Markets Test Multi-Month Lows
data.text: Weaker dollar and lower Treasury yields did not provide support to precious metals.

data.title: Gold Price Forecast: XAU/USD manages to hold above 55-DMA at $1,844 ‚Äì Credit Suisse
data.text: Gold is seeing a minor setback but remains above the 55-Day Moving Average (DMA) at $1,844, which should act as the bottom of a short-term range for now, according to strategists at Credit Suisse

data.title: Gold Price Forecast ‚Äì Gold Markets Give Up Early Gains Again
data.text: Gold markets have given up early gains yet again during the trading session on Thursday. Quite frankly, it seems as if there is a brick wall just above.
